body.p: What is the first step of the process that is altered for people with Diabetes Type 1?

multiple_choice.choice: B - Beta cells in pancreas have glucose receptors
C - Beta cells produce and release insulin into the blood when above set point
D - Increased glucose uptake into fat and muscle cells, glucose stored as glycogen in liver and muscle cells

feedback.p: Correct. Glucose-sensing cells within the pancreas do not function properly.
Incorrect While all steps in a loop end up being affected, it is not the defective part of the feedback loop leading to Type I diabetes.
Incorrect. While all steps in a loop end up being affected, this is not the defective part of the feedback loop leading to Type I diabetes.

body.p: What is the first step of the process that is altered for people with Diabetes Type 2?

multiple_choice.choice: B - Beta cells in pancreas have glucose receptors
C - Beta cells produce and release insulin into the blood when above set point
D - Increased glucose uptake into fat and muscle cells, glucose stored as glycogen in liver and muscle cells

feedback.p: Incorrect. In type 2 diabetes, the pancreatic cells can still sense blood glucose levels.
Incorrect. In type 2 diabetes the beta cells can still make and release insulin.
Correct. People with type 2 diabetes have insulin resistance, which hinders the body's ability to store and use glucose in the muscles and fat.
